lead_paragraph: J. J. Yeley, who will be replaced by Kyle Busch at Joe Gibbs Racing next season, has signed with another team with a National Football League connection. Yeley, 30, will drive the No. 96 car for Hall of Fame Racing in Nascar’s Nextel Cup series starting in 2008, the team said in a statement. Hall of Fame, which was started by the former N.F.L. quarterbacks Roger Staubach and Troy Aikman of the Dallas Cowboys, was sold yesterday to Jeff Moorad and Tom Garfinkel, executives of Major League Baseball’s Arizona Diamondbacks. Staubach and Aikman retained a minority interest in the team.
